titleInfo.title: Temporary receipt, the Newark museum association, Dec. 19, 1929

mods.abstract: Loan receipt between the Newark Museum Association and the Whitney Studio Galleries, dated December 19, 1929. On loan: "Lamp of Sleep" by Oscar Bluemner; "Pink Villa" by Rohland; "White Horses" by Karl Free. These watercolors are on loan for the American Watercolor Exhibition. For related business correspondence, see also: Registrar's Department, Newark Museum Association to Whitney Studio Galleries, December 27, 1929 (wscg.0680); and see also: Registrar's Department, Newark Museum Association to Whitney Studio Galleries, January 18, 1930. (wscg.0681)

titleInfo.title: John D. Graham to Mrs. Cambell, March 31, 1929

mods.abstract: Typed letter written by John Graham to Alice Campbell, Whitney Studio Galleries, dated March 31, 1929. Signed. Informing Campbell that his tempera painting, "Horse and harlequin", was not Dudensing Gallery's possession, since it was exhibited in the Black and White show. Graham is requesting information regarding its whereabouts.

titleInfo.title: Exhibition of modern paintings by American and foreign artists : at Mrs. H.P. Whitney's Studio, 8 West 8, January 5th to 18th, inclusive, 1916

mods.abstract: Catalogue for exhibition of paintings by American and foreign artists held at the Studio, January 5-18, 1916. Artists included: Cecilia Beaux, Paul Albert Besnard, Robert W. Chanler, Howard G. Cushing, Frederic C. Freiseke, Beatrice How, George B. Luks, John Lavery, Ernest Lawson, William Orpen, John S. Sargent, Lucien Simon, Ioaquin Sorolla y Bastida, Ettore Tito, Ignacio Zuloaga, Robert Henri, Giovanni Boldini, George W. Bellows, Wiliam T. Glackens, Gennaro Favai, Arthur B. Davies, William A. Delano, Maxfield Parrish, Warren B. Davis, Franz St√ºck, Jules Gu√©rin, Edmond Dulac, Gaston La Touche, John La Farge. Title from cover. The physical copy scanned is a photocopy made from microfilm.
